SEARCH
Package BackEndUtility

Class DataBase

java.lang.Object
BackEndUtility.DataBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DataBase extends Object implements Serializable
Class that represents the database of the platform, which contains all the users, products, and orders. Can be serialized after each session to make the data persistent.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    DataBase()

    Constructor for a new database taking pre-made users as parameter

      Method to get a user from the database, given his id and password
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the wanted user
      password - the password of the corresponding user
      Returns:
      a user if the id and password match, null otherwise

      Method to generate and assign the orders of the buyer to the corresponding sellers from the buyer's cart after checkout
      Parameters:
      user - the buyer whose cart is being checked out
      paymentType - the payment type specified by the buyer

      phoneNumber - the phone number specified by the buyer

      public void addProduct(Product product)
      Method to add a product into the database as well as in the corresponding seller's inventory. Also notifies the seller's followers of the new product
      Parameters:
      product - the product to be added

      Method to remove a product from the database as well as from the corresponding seller's inventory

      Returns:
      true if the name is not taken, false otherwise

      Returns:

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all the buyers whose first or last name contains the given string

    • sortBuyer

      public void sortBuyer(boolean ascending, String filter)
      Method to sort the list of buyers in the database by the given filter, in ascending or descending order
      Parameters:
      ascending - true if the list is to be sorted in ascending order, false otherwise
      filter - the filter by which the list is to be sorted

      public boolean validateNewUser(String id, String email)
      Method to check if the given ID and email are not already taken in the database
      Parameters:
      id - the ID to be checked
      email - the email to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the ID and email are not taken, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      user - the user to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the user has connected within 24 hours, false otherwise
